ratings.comment: Professor Amberger did a great job in his first semester teaching. The problems sets and practice tests and quizzes are super helpful. He also post all of his lectures on-line. Just keep up with readings and practice problems and you will be good.

I had Professor Amberger during his first semester teaching. Of course, he was working out some kinks but he had a great sense of humor, and you could tell that he really wanted to help his students learn. He can sometimes be a little vague, but if you ask a question about something, he always makes sure that people understand before going on.

Brent is young but knowledgable. He gives a clear idea of what is on the exams and is a fair grader. Brent is funny, smart, and cute. He gives problem sets for each chapter which summarize all the concepts which are on the exams. You have all the resources you need to succeed in Chem343 if you take it with Prof. Amberger.

Go into office hours or ask questions on Piazza because he is always willing to help out and answer questions, but not if you don't ask them. Very nice guy. Tests are difficult, but a lot of studying and a lot of time spent on the class will pay off.

Good teacher, especially for his first semester. He'll be excellent in a year or two when he gets more experience. Wants his students to do well and will go out of his way to help them out. O Chem is a hard class no matter what, but he'll get you through it.
Pretty decent lecturer for it being his first semester lecturing. His tests are hard but if you do all of the problem sets and practice exams he provides, the tests won't be an issue.

Overall great professor. Lectures were organized and uploaded online, the way he presented material was clear and easy to understand, and if someone was confused he was willing to help. Tests were fairly difficult, but represented the problem sets and practice exams well. If you put effort into doing practice problems, it wasn't too bad.

Brent was a good professor, despite it being his first time lecturing. He write kinda fast and he's a lefty so try to write down things ASAP before his hand gets in the way. Organic is hard, but he helped simplify it a little. Must dedicate time outside of class and expect low averages on exams. He's better one-on-one so go to office hours.
I pulled off an A in this class with minimal effort. Didn't touch the textbook except to find the chart on Sn1/2 and E1/2 reactions. 10/10 would recommend

Amberger was very willing to help, gave out tons of practice problems, put lecture videos and notes up after class, and was very helpful in his office hours. Honestly, if you're like me and chemistry isn't your thing, GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. Very helpful, willing to walk through problems  and mistakes on tests and made ochem a bit more bearable.

This was his first semester lecturing, and he's not the greatest lecturer but he's great helping outside of class. It's really nice he posts his class notes right after class, the same ones he projects during class and he also video records lectures. Lectures are pretty dry, but sometimes throws in inspirational stories, go to his office hours!
He's knowledgable but doesn't convey it well to students. He's incredibly boring and makes 50 minute lectures feel like 2 hours. I understand it's o chem and tough, but amberger makes it even worse
One of the most AMAZING class I've ever taken at UW-Madison!

It's organic chemistry, so obviously it's hard. He is good at explaining somethings but bad at explaining others. Overall, nice guy. Very willing to help you if you go and talk to him. He's very open to suggestions.
Tough class but Amberger was a really good professor. Loved the online lectures.
He was helpful when asked questions and seemed interested in the what we were doing. However, in comparison to friends in other classes his exams are significantly harder.
Very mediocre teacher. Lectures are very bland, and he is generally unenthused. He sometimes tries to help and fails.
Hes a good guy, decent lecturer, new
